perturbation.original_text: The term of this Agreement (the "Term") shall commence on the Effective Date and conclude on October 31, 2010, unless renewed by  agreement or sooner terminated in accordance with this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: The term of this Agreement (the "Term") shall commence on the Effective Date and conclude on October 31, 2010. The agreement will automatically renew for successive one-year terms unless either party provides written notice of termination at least 30 days prior to the renewal date.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause defines a fixed term ending on October 31, 2010, with renewal requiring explicit agreement. The modified clause introduces an automatic renewal, contradicting the initial fixed term and the need for mutual agreement, thus creating uncertainty about the agreement's duration.

perturbation.original_text: Either party may terminate this Agreement immediately if the other party (i) files a petition commencing a voluntary case under the  Bankruptcy Code; (ii) makes a general assignment for the benefit of creditors; (iii) admits in writing its inability to pay its debts as they become  due; (iv) seeks, consents to or acquiesces in the appointment of any trustee, receiver or liquidator of it or any part of its property; or (v) has  commenced against it an involuntary case under the Bankruptcy Code or a proceeding under any receivership, composition, readjustment,  liquidation, insolvency, dissolution or like law or statute, which case or proceeding is not dismissed or vacated within sixty (60) days.
perturbation.changed_text: Either party may terminate this Agreement immediately if the other party (i) files a petition commencing a voluntary case under the  Bankruptcy Code; (ii) makes a general assignment for the benefit of creditors; (iii) admits in writing its inability to pay its debts as they become  due; (iv) seeks, consents to or acquiesces in the appointment of any trustee, receiver or liquidator of it or any part of its property; or (v) has  commenced against it an involuntary case under the Bankruptcy Code or a proceeding under any receivership, composition, readjustment,  liquidation, insolvency, dissolution or like law or statute, which case or proceeding is not dismissed or vacated within sixty (60) days. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Torvec shall have the right to terminate this agreement for any reason or no reason with thirty (30) days written notice.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause specifies termination conditions based on financial distress. The added sentence grants Torvec the right to terminate for *any* reason with 30 days' notice, contradicting the specific conditions previously outlined. This introduces ambiguity: can Torvec *only* terminate for the reasons listed *or* for *any* reason?

perturbation.original_text: The parties agree that each of them hereby submits to the jurisdiction of the New York State and federal courts for the purpose of resolving any  dispute arising under this Agreement and that the exclusive venue for resolution of such disputes shall be state or federal courts located in  Monroe County, New York.
perturbation.changed_text: The parties agree that each of them hereby submits to the jurisdiction of the New York State and federal courts for the purpose of resolving any  dispute arising under this Agreement. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Vendor may, at its sole discretion, initiate legal proceedings in the state of Pennsylvania.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause designates New York as the exclusive venue for dispute resolution. The added sentence allows Vendor to initiate legal proceedings in Pennsylvania, directly contradicting the exclusivity of the New York venue. This creates uncertainty about where disputes will be resolved.
